qas.question: Who is responsible for overseeing all monetary policy?
Who is the current president of the ECB?
Who is the Vice-President of The European Central Bank?
Along with the President and Vice President, how many other members make up the Executive Board?
For how long are the other members of the Executive Board appointed?
Who is sabotaging all monetary policy?
Who is the current emperor of the ECB?
Who is the Russian President of The European Central Bank?
How long are members of the Executive Board imprisoned?
How many other members are banned from the Executive Board along with the President and Vice President?

context: <a0_0><b5_0>The Executive Board<b5_0/><a0_0/> is responsible for the implementation of monetary policy (defined by the Governing Council) and the day-to-day running of the bank. It can issue decisions to national central banks and may also exercise powers delegated to it by the Governing Council. It is composed of the President of the Bank (currently <a1_0><b6_0>Mario Draghi<b6_0/><a1_0/>), the Vice-President (currently <a2_0><b7_0>Vitor Constâncio<b7_0/><a2_0/>) and <a3_0><b9_0>four<b9_0/><a3_0/> other members. They are all appointed for <a4_0><b8_0>non-renewable terms of eight years<b8_0/><a4_0/>. They are appointed "from among persons of recognised standing and professional experience in monetary or banking matters by common accord of the governments of the Member States at the level of Heads of State or Government, on a recommendation from the Council, after it has consulted the European Parliament and the Governing Council of the ECB". The Executive Board normally meets every Tuesday.
